item.title: Afghanistan, Pakistan peace talks collapse, ceasefire continues
item.description: Peace negotiations between Afghanistan and Pakistan broke down, although a ceasefire continues between the South Asian neighbours, a Taliban spokesperson said on Saturday. Zabihullah Mujahid said negotiations had failed due to Islamabad insisting that Afghanistan assume responsibility for Pakistan

item.title: Some political parties’ actions may endanger people’s rights: Tarique
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman on Saturday cautioned that the recent actions of certain political parties, who once marched alongside the anti-fascist movement, may now be creating a situation that undermines the rights and opportunities of people. item.title: Police-teacher clash at Shahbagh leaves 120 injured
item.description: At least 120 primary school teachers were injured on Saturday afternoon when police swung into action to disperse their protest march at Shahbagh. Witnesses said the clash broke out around 4 pm when police intercepted the teachers’ ‘Pen Surrender March’ that began from the Centra

item.title: Primary teachers announce nationwide work stoppage from Sunday
item.description: Government primary school teachers have announced a work stoppage from Sunday after a police crackdown on protesters demanding 10th-grade pay. Mohammad Abul Kashem, president of the Bangladesh Primary Teachers’ Association (Kashem-Shahin), announced a continuous sit-in and work stoppage at t

item.title: Female expat tourist goes missing after boat capsizes in Mongla
item.description: An expatriate female tourist went missing on Saturday after a tourist boat capsized while returning from a trip to the Sundarbans. The missing woman has been identified as Riyana Azad, 28, wife of Touhidul Islam, from Bakerganj Upazila in Barishal district. Surjit Chowdhury, officer-in-charge (OC

item.title: NCC Bank signs MoU with DNCC on collection of municipal charges
item.description: NCC Bank has recently signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Dhaka North City Corporation (DNCC), enabling NCC Bank customers to conveniently pay various fees and taxes — including holding tax, trade license fee, hotel tax, market salami, wheel tax, other municipal charges — th

item.title: BRAC Bank and IDCOL finance USD 67 million syndicated loan to BCRECL for large-scale solar power plant
item.description: BRAC Bank PLC and Infrastructure Development Company Limited (IDCOL) have jointly financed a landmark renewable energy initiative,a 64.55 MW solar power plant, operated by Bangladesh China Renewable Energy Company Limited (BCRECL). A ceremony was held on November 6, 2025at InterContinental Dhaka t

item.title: Chief justice calls for moral, not administrative, reform in judiciary
item.description: Chief Justice Syed Refaat Ahmed has said the judiciary must undergo reform to remain “relevant” with the times. Speaking at a reunion event marking the 75th anniversary of Dhaka University’s Department of Islamic History and Culture on Saturday, he said the aim of reform is moral

item.title: Cop dies after falling ill in Cumilla
item.description: A policeman in Cumilla died on Saturday after suddenly falling ill while on duty. The deceased was identified as Md Ashraf, son of the late Kamrul Islam from Imrail village in Kasba upazila of Brahmanbaria, UNB reports. Ashraf was posted at the Debpur Police Outpost under Burichang Police S

item.title: Dhaka Bank holds financial literacy, career counselling program for youth
item.description: Dhaka Bank PLC successfully organized a “Financial Literacy & Career Counselling Program for the Youth” on 26 October 2025 at Lalmatia Government Mohila College, Dhaka. An interactive session, led by Mr. Md. Mostaque Ahmed, Deputy Managing Director of Dhaka Bank PLC, on Career Counsell

item.title: Left Democratic Alliance warns of action if Chittagong Port lease not withdrawn
item.description: The Left Democratic Alliance has warned that it will surround the State Guest House Jamuna, the official residence of the chief adviser, if the ‘plot to hand over the profitable Chittagong Port to foreigners’ is not stopped. item.title: ‘Jubo Dal’ attacks amaat-e-Islami rally in Jamalpur
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami nominated MP candidate Abdus Sattar has accused the Jubo Dal of attacking his election rally in Jamalpur.
